conclusion: To determine the magnitude of the Ampere force acting on the entire wire frame, we need to consider the forces acting on both the straight and curved parts of the wire frame.
The straight part of the wire frame is subjected to an Ampere force F due to the current I flowing through it in the presence of a magnetic field B.
The length of the straight part is 2r (since it spans the diameter of the semi-circular frame).
Solving for I, we get I = F / (2rB).
The curved part of the wire frame is a semi-circle with radius r.
The length of the curved part is πr.

premise: The force on each infinitesimal segment dL of the curved part is dF = B I dL.
conclusion: Integrating over the semi-circle, the total force on the curved part is F_curved = B I (πr).

premise: Using I = F / (2rB), substitute into the expression for F_curved.
The force on the straight part is F. The force on the curved part is Fπ / 2.
conclusion: The total force is F_total = F + Fπ / 2 = F (1 + π / 2).
